segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water from the faucet flows freely, but she doesn’t seem to notice the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a little surprised at how oblivious she is to the growing puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s strange to see someone so focused on a single task when everything else is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children seem to be plotting something mischievous behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy teetering precariously on the stool, stretching his hand toward the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Every moment he spends up there makes my heart race a little faster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the little girl stands there with her palm open, waiting for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their innocence is charming, but it also worries me. What if he falls?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would just look around, but she seems so caught up in her chores.
segments.speaker: PAR
